item.title: Folder Structure
item.description: Hugo Site Generation Hugo is website generator used to build accelerators. This allows us to quickly generate a site, with custom theming and integration with Github pages. Most of the Hugo code sits in the accelerator-web-ui-template repo, but for the site to get generated a few things are needed. Content: This folder contains all of the markdown files that make up the content of the site Workflows: This folder contains the github action with site specific configuration Content Folder The content folder defines the structure of the site.

item.title: Markdown Syntax
item.description: Headers ## Chapter Header ### Page Header #### Subheader renders to: Chapter Header Page Header Subheader Formats **Bold** renders to Bold *Italic* renders to Italic ~Strikethrough~ renders to ~Strikethrough~ > Blockquote. renders to >Blockquote `inline code` renders to inline code

item.title: Notice
item.description: There are 4 types of notice add structure to your page. Note {{% notice note %}} This is a note {{% /notice %}} renders as This is a note Info {{% notice info %}} An information notice {{% /notice %}} renders as An information notice Tip {{% notice tip %}} A tip notice {{% /notice %}} renders as A tip notice Warning {{% notice warning %}} A warning notice {{% /notice %}} renders as

item.title: Local Testing
item.description: To test the site locally you will need to install Hugo via brew: brew install hugo The github action will deploy the site with the theme included, however to test locally you will need to add the below files to your project. Attachments ThemeFiles.zip (8 MB) To view the hugo site run: hugo serve The site should be available at localhost:1313/{ACCELERATOR_NAME}

item.title: Mermaid
item.description: Mermaid is a library that generates charts and diagrams in markdown. Gantt Chart Gantt charts are used to demonstrate how long an accelerator will take. {{<mermaid>}} gantt dateFormat HH-mm axisFormat %M section 1. Step 1 1h :step1, 00-00, 1m section 2. Step 2 2h :step2, after step1, 2m section 3. Step 3 3h :step3, after step2, 3m {{</mermaid>}} Renders to: gantt dateFormat HH-mm axisFormat %M section 1. Step 1 1h :step1, 00-00, 1m section 2.

item.title: Tabs
item.description: Tabs can be handy for providing code snippets for multiple languages or providing configuration in different formats. {{< tabs groupId="tab_id" >}} {{% tab name="Tab 1" %}} ### Tab 1 {{% /tab %}} {{% tab name="Tab 2" %}} ### Tab 2 {{% /tab %}} {{</tabs >}} Tab 1 Tab 2 Tab 1 Tab 2

item.title: Attachments
item.description: The Attachments shortcode displays a list of files attached to a page. This is useful for providing sample data and notebooks. The attachments need to be placed in a pages.files folder. For example, if a page is named test_page attachments need to be added to a folder called test_page.files. {{%attachments style="blue"/%}} renders to Attachments sample-attachment.txt (27 B)

item.title: Deploy
item.description: To deploy the hugo site, add the attached deploy.yml and save it in a .github/workflows folder. Attachments deploy.yml (1 KB) Edit the environment variables below to match your acclerator. Once you push to main the accelerator should be available on the gh-pages site. env: TITLE: YOUR_TITLE_HERE DESCRIPTION: YOUR_DESCRIPTION_HERE BASE_URL: https://docs.snowplow.io/GITHUB-REPO-NAME AUTHOR: AUTHOR LANDING_PAGE_URL: /GITHUB-REPO-NAME

item.title: Embedding Notebooks
item.description: To embed a notebook, you can use the jupyter shortcode as below: {{< jupyter filename 1000 >}} Click here to view this notebook in full screen
